activity_2.focus: Simple Present - third person singular, Yes/No questions, WH-questions

activity_2_e.text:
Listen to each question, use the pause to answer it, then compare your response with the model answer.
සෑම ප්‍රශ්නයකටම සවන් දෙන්න, පිළිතුරු දීමට විරාමය භාවිතා කරන්න, ඉන්පසු ඔබේ පිළිතුර ආදර්ශ පිළිතුර සමඟ සසඳන්න.
ஒவ்வொரு கேள்வியையும் கேட்டு, இடைவெளியைப் பயன்படுத்தி பதிலளியுங்கள். பின்னர் உங்கள் பதிலை மாதிரி பதிலுடன் ஒப்பிடுங்கள்.

tables: What kind of food does he cook?

example_dialogues.text_a: Does Ann prepare Indian dishes on Tuesday?
example_dialogues.text_c: When does she prepare Indian dishes?
example_dialogues.text_d: She prepares Indian dishes on Monday.

example_dialogues.text_a: Does Muhamed prepare Thai dishes on Monday?
example_dialogues.text_c: When does he prepare Thai dishes?
example_dialogues.text_d: He prepares Thai dishes on Tuesday.

example_dialogues.text_a: Does Muhamed prepare German dishes on Thursday?
example_dialogues.text_c: When does he prepare German dishes?
example_dialogues.text_d: He prepares German dishes on Wednesday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Ann prepare German dishes on Thursday?
dialogues.text_c: When does she prepare German dishes?
dialogues.text_d: She prepares German dishes on Wednesday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Ann prepare Swiss dishes on Saturday?
dialogues.text_c: When does she prepare Swiss dishes?
dialogues.text_d: She prepares Swiss dishes on Friday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Ann prepare Sri Lankan dishes on Saturday?
dialogues.text_c: When does she prepare Sri Lankan dishes?
dialogues.text_d: She prepares Sri Lankan dishes on Sunday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Muhamed prepare French dishes on Wednesday?
dialogues.text_c: When does he prepare French dishes?
dialogues.text_d: He prepares French dishes on Thursday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Muhamed prepare Japanese dishes on Friday?
dialogues.text_c: When does he prepare Japanese dishes?
dialogues.text_d: He prepares Japanese dishes on Saturday.

dialogues.text_a: Does Muhamed prepare Indian dishes on Friday?
dialogues.text_c: When does he prepare Indian dishes?
dialogues.text_d: He prepares Indian dishes on Monday.

Choose the correct answer.
 නිවැරදි පිළිතුර තෝරන්න.
 சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

examples.sentence: Does Kala  learn about vehicle safety on Monday morning?

content.sentence: Does she follow a class on  gearbox overhauling on Tuesday morning?
Does Kala have a session on braking systems on Wednesday morning?
content.answer: No, she doesn’t, but she has  a session on vehicle service procedures.

content.sentence: Does she attend an electrical systems  lesson on Thursday morning?
Does Kala study vehicle body repair on Friday morning?
content.answer: No, she doesn’t, but she studies automotive electrical systems.

content.sentence: Does she practise tyre balancing on Monday before lunch?
Does Kala join a session on lubrication systems on Tuesday before lunch?
Does she learn about lubrication  fluids on Wednesday before lunch?
Does Kala take part in car painting practice on Thursday afternoon?
Does she do brake system maintenance on Friday afternoon?
content.answer: No, she doesn’t, but she does vehicle performance testing.

content.sentence: Does Kala remove and refit wheels on Monday afternoon?

context.text:
Read the passage below carefully before you attempt the activities.
පහත පරිච්ඡේදය සලකා බලන්න. ඔබ ක්‍රියාකාරකම් උත්සාහ කිරීමට පෙර.
கீழே உள்ள பகுதியை கவனமாகப் படியுங்கள்.

activity_a.text:
Match the words to their definitions.
පදයන් ඔවුන්ගේ අර්ථයන්ට ගැලපෙන්න.
சொற்களை அவற்றின் வரையறைகளுடன் பொருத்துங்கள்.

activity_b.text:
Read the questions and choose the correct answer.
ප්‍රශ්න කියවන්න සහ නිවැරදි පිළිතුර තෝරන්න.
கேள்விகளைப் படித்து சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

activity_c.text:
Put these jumbled words in the correct order, to make a sentence.
මෙම අකුරු ගැටුම් නිවැරදි අනුපිළිවෙලට තබා වාක්‍යයක් සාදන්න.
இந்த குழப்பமான வார்த்தைகளை சரியான வரிசையில் வைத்து ஒரு வாக்கியமாக மாற்றுங்கள்.

content.intro: The AutoTune 500 Digital Engine Analyser is designed for diagnostic testing of petrol and diesel engines.

subsections.subtitle: Main Components
items: Control Panel – contains the digital display, mode selector, and test buttons.
Probe Leads – connect to spark-plug wires or sensors for measurement.
RPM Clamp – measures engine speed directly from the ignition coil.
Battery Leads (Red/Black) – provide power and detect battery voltage.
USB Port – for connecting to a computer or diagnostic tablet.
Data Port (OBD-II) – interfaces with modern vehicles for ECU readings.
Cooling Fan Vent – prevents overheating during extended use.
Carrying Handle – for easy transport between work bays.

steps: Unpack the analyser and check for all accessories.
Connect the battery leads: red to positive (+), black to negative (–).
Attach the RPM clamp around the ignition cable if required.
Plug the OBD-II connector into the vehicle diagnostic port (usually under the dashboard).
Press the Power button to start the unit.
Select the test mode (RPM, Voltage, Timing, Emission, or Sensor Check) on the control panel.
For data logging, connect the USB cable to your computer and open the AutoTune Utility Software.

subsections.subtitle: Engine Test
items: Choose “Engine Diagnostics”.
Start the vehicle engine.
The display will show RPM, voltage, and timing advance readings.

subsections.subtitle: Battery & Charging Test
items: Select “Battery Mode”.
Follow on-screen prompts to measure charge rate and alternator output.

subsections.subtitle: Sensor Test
items: Select the sensor type (e.g. oxygen sensor or throttle position sensor).
Observe live data on the screen or save results to the USB drive.

subsections.subtitle: Data Export
items: Connect to PC.
Open AutoTune Utility.
Click “Export Report” to generate a PDF summary.

subsections.subtitle: Common Issues and Solutions
items: No Power: Check clamps and vehicle battery connection.
No Reading: Ensure probes and OBD-II cable are firmly connected.
Inaccurate RPM Display: Adjust clamp position or recalibrate in settings.
Software Not Detecting Device: Reinstall the AutoTune driver or use another USB port.

subsections.subtitle: Maintenance Tips
items: Keep leads clean and store them in the provided case.
Wipe the screen and body with a dry, lint-free cloth.
Do not expose it to rain or high humidity.
Update firmware via the official AutoTune website every six months.
Always turn off the engine before connecting or disconnecting cables.
Keep cables away from hot engine parts.
Use only original accessories.
Do not attempt to open the unit; servicing must be done by authorised technicians.

content.item_b: a plan that shows the times at which activities or classes happen
the practice of keeping people safe and healthy while they work
the ability to speak, listen, and write effectively
learning by doing tasks in a real or simulated work environment
a test or assessment to check progress or performance
official or correct ways of doing something, especially at work

Does he use the equipment before ten o’clock?
Does Kamal leave anything  on the table after lunch?
options: Only when he is in a hurry.

activity_c.sentence: The mechanic checks the brakes every day.
She didn’t drive the bus today.
Did they replace the clutch yesterday?
The trainee checks the tyre pressure daily.
He washed the car in the garage.
